Technique: HEWN; PAINTED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Unfinished funerary stela
Description: Three-quarters of the stela are occupied by a vignette representing the owner, wrapped in a long fringed mantle, in adoration before a mummy with the head of a falcon. This last is wearing a solar disk and holds a sceptre in the hand. The upper part of the stela carries an inscription of two lines, mentioning the name of the owner and of his parents.
